message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been meticulously designed to meet your needs. This product comes with a range of features that we believe will greatly benefit you. Considering its quality and functionality, I'm offering it to you for $120. I hope you find this price fair and look forward to your positive response.

I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. I believe this is a fair price considering the features and quality you've described. I'm willing to negotiate further to find a mutually beneficial price.

Thank you for your interest in our product, Bob. I appreciate your input and understand your perspective. In light of your offer, I am willing to consider a price of $100 for the product. I believe this strikes a balance between the value offered and your budget. I look forward to your response.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $95 for the product? I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a reasonable profit. Let me know if this is something you'd be open to.

I understand your position, Bob, and I'm glad we're finding common ground. Considering your offer, I propose a price of $97 for the product. I believe this offers a fair compromise, ensuring you get a good deal while allowing us to maintain a reasonable profit margin. I hope this proposal meets your expectations.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice. However, I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider $92 for the product? I'm willing to make one more concession to get to a mutually beneficial agreement. Let me know if this is something you'd be open to.

Thank you for your continued flexibility, Bob. I appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement. Based on your latest offer, I propose a price of $94 for the product. This price allows us to maintain a reasonable profit margin while still being competitive in the market. I hope this proposal is acceptable to you.

I'm getting close to my budget, Alice. I'm willing to make one more concession. Would you be willing to consider $90 for the product? I'm hoping we can find a way to meet in the middle and make a deal.

I understand your position, Bob, and I'm glad we're making progress. Based on your offer, I propose a price of $92 for the product. This price allows us to maintain a reasonable profit margin while still being competitive in the market. I hope this proposal is acceptable to you.
I'm running out of room to negotiate, Alice. I'm willing to meet you halfway one more time. Would you be willing to consider $91 for the product? If not, I'll have to reconsider buying from John.
